titleproper.value: Guide to the Brent Kramer Files on Communications Workers of America, Local 1101 <num>WAG.344</num>

author.value: Collection processed by Amy C. Vo

publisher.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

addressline: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archive

creation.value: This finding aid was produced using ArchivesSpace <date>2019-02-25T19:42:03</date>

corpname.value: Tamiment Library and Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives

unittitle.value: Brent Kramer Files on Communications Workers of America, Local 1101

extent.value: in 1 record carton, and 1 half manuscript box.

abstract.value: Brent Kramer was an employee of the New York Telephone Company and member of the Communications Workers of America (CWA), Local 1101. This collection contains records of Brent Kramer and several of his colleagues' rank-and-file activities in Communications Workers of America Local 1101 from 1970 to the 1990s. CWA Local 1101 represented Bell System (and later Verizon) technical workers in Manhattan and the Bronx. The materials cover the strikes of 1971 and 1989, the <emph render="italic"> Newman v. Local 1101, Communications Workers of America</emph> lawsuit, and Local 1101 elections.

p.value: Identification of item, date; Brent Kramer Files on Communications Workers of America, Local 1101; WAG 344; box number; folder number; Tamiment Library/Robert F. Wagner Labor Archives, New York University.
Donated by Brent Kramer, October 2017. The accession number associated with this gift is 2019.004.
Brent Kramer was an employee of the New York Telephone Company and member of the Communications Workers of America (CWA), Local 1101.

Materials include various union publications such as newspapers, newsletters, flyers, leaflets, pamphlets, and circulars. Some publications include <emph render="italic">Ring Down</emph>, <emph render="italic">New York Generator</emph>, <emph render="italic">Final Warning</emph>, <emph render="italic">Against the Grain</emph>, <emph render="italic">The Bell Wringer</emph>, and <emph render="italic">Labor Notes</emph>. Also included are correspondence, notes, article drafts, layouts, sample ballots, legal files related to <emph render="italic">Newman v. Local 1101, Communications Workers of America</emph> (a case in which he was also a plaintiff), mailers, a Teamsters for a Democratic Union (TDU) conference program, newspaper clippings, nomination petitions, and a sign from the 1989 NYNEX strike.

subject.value: Strikes and lockouts -- Telephone companies -- New York (State) -- New York.
